caption: Not too many places for turkish food in Hawaii. Highly recommend. The lamb kabobs melt in your mouth! Also get the app sampler to try a little bit of everything. They did an amazing job with the build out.

Nice outdoor seating but no water view, it overlooks the street. However, amazing food despite being expensive and the portions are small. We had the hot Mazza, and kafta  donar kabab(wasn't anything special, was OK)  Nice for a romantic date
Delicious food. Best hummus on the island. Land was terrific.
Good food, very close to authentic. The bar was lightly stocked with a fine selection of spirits.
A taste of Balkan food in Honolulu, loved it! Did not enjoy the one hour wait with a baby, make sure to have a reservation.

If you’re looking for authentic Mediterranean experience, this is the place to go! Great customer service from the server, explain the menu really well and answered all my questions. She also offered personal recommendations on the menu. The food was delicious, well balanced mediterranean cuisine with island twist. I tried the eggplant with rice. My husband had the lamb chops with side salad. The drinks a little pricey but worth it. The baklava with the Turkish coffee, perfect desert with the perfect meal.
One of the few great mediterranean restaurants in Hawaii. It’s new modern and well designed. It’s casual and trendy. The food is very tasty, great flavors and spices for the Turkish fusion dishes.

Ambient is really nice inside out. We had the Rib Bye and lambs döner, both items tasted good, Rib Bye was well done and not as tender as I expected. Both items are main dishes " hardly " you need to order more because they're relatively small for a main course. It's overpriced and overrated as I personally traveled to Turkey 🇹🇷 and had a real taste of the local cuisine.

I may be spoiled with exemplary Mediterranean in my residential area but I was underwhelmed with the food at Istanbul Hawaii. The hummus was so so compared to the restaurant’s neighbor. The portion for my expensive lamb plate was disappointing. That said, the sauces were rich but pretty good. However, perhaps because of the richness of the food or oil or something, my little one and I both had sour stomachs the next day. Thankfully, my partner didn’t eat dinner with us that night. He felt fine. So the food was a good change from all the fish but if you aren’t fed up with the local fare, I would skip this place. Or try Merriman’s next door. It’s a bit more expensive, but you may enjoy the meal better. And you aren’t likely to feel bad the next day.

So glad we stumbled upon this place! Fun atmosphere, kind staff, cute dishes, perfect cocktails and delicious food! Splurge on the Pirzola - so worth it! Trying to squeeze another visit or two in before we have to leave!

Food was fabulous. The lamb tenderloin shish was so tender and so flavorful I cannot give high enough accolades. All sides dishes were also just jam packed with zesty tastes that really popped. Without a doubt the best Mediterranean food on the island.

First time dining here, but been wanting to get good authentic Turkish food since moving to HI. I’d say this is pretty close! I love how they source their ingredients locally and everything is presented nicely but most importantly tastes amazing! I had the lamb shis, lamb was cooked to perfection and spiced nicely. The rosewater and watermelon refresher was definitely refreshing but not too sweet, which I personally prefer.  Imam biyaldi eggplants were spot on, cooked very well and the sauce and saffron rice that came with it were flavorful also.  I loved the kunefe. Less sweeter than I expected which is very nice. It had a nice blend of flavors and texture. I highly recommend this dessert if you’re not familiar with it. It’s both crunchy and gooey from the cheese at the same time. We hoped to have decaf coffee with it but our server let us know that they don’t serve decaf. This was at dinner time so we tried to avoid the caffeine. It would be nice to have herbal/non-caffeinated warm drinks for people who can’t have caffeine.  Service was attentive and great! We didn’t have reservations but we were seated outdoors in like a bench/ bar? It was okay for the weather but might not be too pleasant in the heat so I suggest making a reservation in advance.  Overall, our dine in experience met and exceeded all expectations. Hope to come back soon.
If you are looking for authentic Turkish food, this place will make you satisfied. Food, vibe, location, and staff are the best. I really recommend the Meza plater and Kanafeh

authentic Turkish restaurant is packed. I loved the vibe, music, decor. you can see owner working hard in the kitchen. must try. but dinner reservation has to be made super in advance. for lunch-is easier. Baklava is to die for!
Excellent food, friendly staff, absolutely wonderful.

Called for reservations and they are booked.  They said they have some walk-ins as they don’t book 100%.  Walk-in and they are 100% booked with the reservations.  Inconsistent message to patrons.  The hostess is unhelpful and unable to provide meaningful information or answer questions. Caveat: The place is always full of customers and has a beautiful outdoor seating area.  *UPDATE* It took 2.5 weeks to be able to dine at Istanbul.  After several attempts to wait for a table by walk-in and being told they were not seating additional guests (at 6:50pm) for the remainder of the night we persevered and it certainly paid off.  Now we know why the wait! Josh was our server who knew the menu inside and out.  He provided detailed recommendations and great alternatives for drinks, appetizers, and entrees. Highly recommend you request to be seated in Josh’s section! Food selection: Mezze appetizer was fabulous but is quite a bit of food for two. IZMIR KOFTE and HEARTY MUSAKKA were flavorful, fresh and hearty.  The protein is seasoned well and moist.  The saffron rice is neutral and pairs very well. The baclava is the best I’ve had in some time and is my favorite dessert that I’ve sampled around the world. Miguel was the food runner and delivered the food with care and attention to detail.  Very polite and courteous, Miguel is a great teammate. Sammy was on her game making sure our table was never crowded And our cups were always full. This will be a bit pricy for a meal, but it is unmatched in Hawaii and superior quality, specialized and immensely flavorful.  Strongly recommend the effort to dine for a special occasion and splurge!
Really good first impression today. Will move my rating up to 5 stars after my next visit. Not a mark on them, more on me because of my relative inexperience. I shall return!
Awesome food, great service, and nice ambiance....it was everything we wanted it to be. Appetizers, entrée, dessert.....all amazing! Lamb chops where the best in recent memory. Baklava was AWESOME!
Awesome interior but overcharge for so so food.
Amazing food, customer service and ambience. Our server even gave us a little extra treat for dining there on our anniversary night. Will definitely be going back!
Food is authentic and tasty but portions are microscopic and way overpriced.

Really excellent meal. The menu is traditional Turkish, but the style is elevated with creativity to match the price point (albeit relative to Honolulu). They had plenty of outdoor seating, with space between tables, to accommodate our COVID caution. Cocktail was ok, you can drink if you want but the food is the highlight. The babaganoush was roasty, but not deeply smoky, it had a lightness in the flavor. Similarly, the lentil soup wasn’t gritty, and a spritz of lemon added delicious complexity to the flavor. The lamb chop was melt-in-your-mouth, covered in delicious herbs and spices.
Wonderful food, beautiful indoor and outdoor seating space and such a warm friendly environment! We had a great experience here and will be back soon!

I have been here several times already and it is fantastic. This is as close as one gets to authentic Turkish (some of the main dishes like Iskender Kebab, the lamb chops Pirzola, and Kunefe) outside of Turkey. I have lived in Turkey for about 1.5 years and one would be hard-pressed to find Turkish cuisine outside of the ubiquitous donor kebab.  While the price is high due several combinations of its location in Kaka'ako and the ingredients from either Turkey or local grass-fed meat. The plates being served doesn't feel they skim on ingredients and its true to form on what I consider a strong representative of Turkish cuisine in Hawaii.  The place seems to always be busy, so reservations are highly recommended. Service is pretty standard if they are completely busy, so have some Turkish tea and be patient.

Pretty good experience overall.  Great outdoor seating and top notch attentive service.  We ordered a side of Baba Ghanoush, Saganaki and a couple Lamb Shish Skewers and not bad at all, was impressed.  The saffron rice was also tasty but the Baba Ghanoush could be more flavorful though, it tasted bland and more like hummus.  The saganaki was tasty and I LOVE saganaki.  Now I am not a lamb lover because of the after taste and after having it, I didn’t taste the aftertaste which was great.  We had baklava for dessert and that to me was the best part of my meal and the best baklava I have ever had.  I am from Toronto where cuisine is diverse and robust so it’s a lot to compare to.
We love this place

Food was so good here! It was definitely busy so try to get a reservation. Also because they are busy it’s understandable they try to move the service along. My group tried a variety of dishes and sharing is the way to go so you can a little bit of each. The mezze sampler to start was perfect, and I would try to vary different protein dishes to share afterwards! Great lamb dishes to try.

The food is good (mostly) but not worth the price.  For $18 you will receive an average portion of a gyro (lamb, onion, tomato, pita + tomato sauce and a side of tziki.) While mine was good, my partner’s was soaked in liquid from a careless helping of tomato.  The wait time was short but wait for food exceeded 20+ minutes. Some items were forgotten and I didn’t receive a clear answer on whether they did or did not have tea made (and gave up trying when I was halfway through my meal.)  Service was a little inconsistent. Our server was polite but scarcely seen. I think she may have been overtasked so I’d consider coming on a day when it’s not too busy if you’re in a hurry.
absolutely our favorite restaurant
Really tasty authentic food. Great, friendly, attentive service. Left stuffed and completely satisfied.

Do not pay attention to the negative reviews! This place was PHENOMENAL! If you’re looking to try new food, especially culturally unique food in Hawaii this is the place to go!  Yes prices are pretty steep, but for the ingredients used (saffron, lots of spices, GREAT quality meat), exceptional staff and small cooking team that you can watch cooking inside, and great location and ambiance, it is absolutely worth it!! Drinks are expensive like beer but it was from Germany and is very difficult to find in any local store/restaurant. Definitely think better to go for dinner than lunch but I’m sure lunch is great too!  GET THE LAMB!! The first one listed at the land portion of the dinner menu. I never found lamb to be that great but this one had everyone’s eyes pop out because of how good it was! Everyone agreed it was the best lamb they have ever had in their life. Literally like butter, melting in our mouth. Super tender and very flavorful.  I’m a cheap 21 year old foodie and it’s rare I am satisfied paying so much for food. Took my family here and all 5/5 of us were extremely satisfied with our food.
Amazing food. Got to sit outside. So great to have Turkish coffee again.

Our waitress Savvi was extremely sweet and helpful. Every staff member was just as sweet and helpful as well. The food was amazing too. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for delicious Mediterranean food and a cute vibe.
Everything was delicious, we left thoroughly satisfied. My Turkish authority also gave it many mmmm's of approval and a few thumbs up. Be sure to save room for the kunefe!!
Amazing food, definitely worth a try.

I was lucky enough to dine here. The service was like clockwork. Each dish is prepared with with a lot of time and love that is apparent not just in their presentation but with each bite you take. Lamb chops are delicious, baklava is on point, wines are great, ambiance is beautiful.

What an experience! The food is incredible, staff is friendly and attentive. It is a women and family owned. The atmosphere is elegant yet comfortable. I highly recommend meze platter, lamb chop and kunefe. We will dine there whenever we visit Honolulu. I’m still thinking about that lamb. If you want to feel transported into city Istanbul at the heart of Honolulu, you should visit it at least once. We can’t wait to go back. Atmosphere:5 Value:5 Service:5 Food:10 out of 5

Very bad experience since one of our plates had a worm. I understand that mistakes happen in a kitchen but this reflects your quality control. Unfortunately, we both lost the apetite and did not eat the rest of our dishes. From a service perspective, staff was a bit too shy to deal with this situation. Manager came up to me and blamed it on “Covid”. Honestly, I did not expect them to charge us at all (given the experience) but the restaurant did not even hesitate sending us check for everything exept for the plate with a worm. Really expensive lunch for the experience we got.

Located in the Waiea building on the backside near Waimanu Street. This is Turkey cuisine available in Hawai’i.  I wanted to find out what the hype was about and honestly was impressed with the service and the food.  You do have to like Greek style foods tho. Think Humus, Slavaki, pita, olives, peppers etc.

No really a good place for vegetarian, overall the food was okay, i did find it to be quite expensive perhaps of the ambiance or the area its located in. the staff is very friendly. Again the food does not do justice to the price.

I want to give more stars but my experience had a few bumps. The online menu apparently was incorrectly price. The price was a lunch menu. What two items order was thought to be $45 came out to be $63. The hostess  reassured be the portion is larger  with the dinner menu. So what you see is the portion sizes. As a reference the bowl size is like a single size bowl of chili from zippys. The bowls was packed only 3/4 full and all for $63. I dont think i need to say anymore.I didnt mind paying with the mindset to support the local economy. Unfortunately, I will not return. Quality of the dishes did not speak to me to justify the price for takeout. I wish instanbul the best.

Food and ambiance were excellent. A bit pricey but I don't think you'll be disappointed. Wait staff were friendly and quick to make rounds.  They observed covid-19 procedures and kept social distancing.

Food was great.  Service was great.  Price to portion ratio was high, but not high enough for me to downgrade the score.  Ambience.... good, with a few qualifiers:  So the place's design and decor was fantastic.  The general feeling was good and I really wanted to enjoy it, but the place echoes and amplifies noise.  Paired with that, there was a *really* noisy gal with a Fran Drescher laugh one table over.  What should have been an "outstanding" dining experience turned out to be only "good".  I had to lean in very close to the others at my table to be heard.  Understand the laughing lady is beyond staff control, but I would advise the store to take a look at the noise levels.  Understandably, there is a balance between energy and relaxation for every restaurant environment, but it definitely degraded our dining experience yesterday.

Exceptionally beautiful place, great people, superb lamb (I usually don't eat lamb, but this place knows how to cook lamb to perfection. Musakka was heart warming. Kunefe and baklava were amazing. They also have craft cocktails and unique wines. My hubby and I are definitely going back there soon. Make sure to have a reservation, otherwise waiting times are long. We didn't have a reservation and waited almost one hour for a table. But we are glad we waited.

Very expensive for really small meals. Waiters are nice but service is bad. I called to make a reservation and they let me sit on a bar next to the door (its somethig they should tell me in the phone if they dont have a table). Long waiting time for the food to come out. We were sitting 2 people and my husband got first his meal- pass 10 minutes till i got mine. The meals were really tasty- specially the musaka, but again really small amount for meal that cost 34$. Also the hummus and the babaganush really small amount for their price. The dessert was good. I ordered kunefe and i liked even though i tasted better - but for me it did the job. Ill definitely wont come back, sadly. I cane to celebrate my husband birthday and we came out in a really bad feeling. I hope that the restaurant will take my review as a way to get better that might other people enjoy and wont happen same thing that happen to us.
Great new tastes and delightful dishes. We don't really getTurkish food here soIstanbul is a welcome addition to the good scene.
I have eaten here a few times now and Istanbul Hawaii does not disappoint. The staff is incredibly nice. All of the food is made to perfection. It is a great addition to the area.
Way too overpriced and mediocre food

Finally a real authentic one in Hawaii. This place is Amazing starting from the food ending with the service. The seatings are cool which you can choose to set inside or outside. Let's talk about the food, I tried this restaurant more than once and ordered different dishes. In my opinion,  all of them taste good and has a real original flavors like you eating in Istanbul. Meze platter good as starter and main dish I liked the lamb plate or the doner plate to the end the dessert baklava and kunafa are must. The cocktails are different than any place in the island and I recommend to try them. The manger is nice as well the service. Enjoy

Visited for kids birthday for lunch and were blown away by the high quality and a very unique flavors. We ordered meze platter, iskender kebab, lamb tenderloin shish and baklava for desert. All the dishes were amazing. Highly recommended if you want to experience an authentic Turkish cuisine, especially a very tender and tasty grilled lamb that melts in your mouth. Nothing like this anywhere in Hawaii!

Beautiful little restaurant adjacent to the Whole Foods in Kaka’ako. the server really made the experience what it was and really took it to the next level. The food was good and as I am not overly familiar with Turkish dishes I had no idea what to expect. The food pairings with the recommended beverages were amazing. Very craft beverages demanding you stop by even if just for a drink.

Went for dinner and the food was good but overpriced. Tried to come back a couple of days later for a late lunch at 3pm but was told they stop seating people for lunch at 2:30 even though their website says they serve lunch until 4.

Too expensive and wine marked up too much... left message on phone to reserve...on arriving was told very crowded and answering machine had not taken our reservation.  So... than seated after some wait.. ... then noticed most seats empty for duration of meal...won't go back... no fun and high prices...wait staff very attentive and polite though.
The food the service is perfect I will go back for sure And  murad u welcome in Egypt anytime 🤙🏼
While it is not cheap to dine here, the food is delicious and authentic. Service is excellent. Beautiful establishment. My only regret was not leaving a bigger tip.

Can't take phone orders properly, it seems.  Two of my phone orders within 2 weeks were not even in their system by the time I arrived. That meant extra 20-30 minute wait.  I would expect least get an acknowledgement from someone up the food chain, but managers seem to be more intent on ignoring hangry customers than talking to them.  Spend your take out time elsewhere, plenty of places around Kakaako.
This place gets 5 stars for service. Food was decent. Atmosphere was great and you can bring your dogs which I love. Why don't all restaurants allow dogs?

Ordered take out from their website, their online menu was easy to use and included great pictures and descriptions of the dishes! We ordered several things which were all delicious, but the Sarma Dolma, Imam Bayildi, and Souvlaki were especially fantastic. We were very impressed and absolutely will be return customers!
Everything I have had on the menu is amazing.  Great Mediterranean food.

Great food. Considering the times we are in now, the staff did a great job. Very friendly for sure.  Experiment with what's on their menu, like we did, and you will for sure discover some amazing tastes.  Will return for sure.

You have to visit this place. We have been in Turkey and Greece. This place feels like you step into Turkey. The food is absolutely amazing. It is super cool that they have a projector shows places from Turkey. I love the colors, ambiance, details and our waiter was very attentive. Definitely try all their mezes and desserts. My date had a meze platter and baklava and I had a pirzola, kunefe and lion's milk cocktail. Great date place, but be careful you may end up eating too much there. Everything was memorable.
I felt like in Istanbul. True taste of Turkish food. The baklava was the best I have ever had in the US. 😍

I went this place with my husband couple days ago. Food is unbelievable. Everything is fresh, perfectly spiced and proportion. I love mezze platter which has variety of flavors like hummus, dolmas , water borek and more. I tried lamb and it was absolutely wonderful and melted in my mouth. Server was very attentive and ambiance was just simply wonderful. Drinks were so refreshing. Open kitchen, Turkish coffee cups, copper tray, handmade tables... Everything was great however I am very impressed about Covid-19 precautions. All the tables are spread out, entire staff members wear mask all the time, they clean and sanitize tables between customers. They allow certain amount people in their restaurant. Overall Istanbul restaurant is very clean and tasty!!! We will be back

The kunefe is out of this world and unlike anything you will find in Hawaii. My wife and I have already visited twice since the opening and we can’t get enough of the food! My wife is Turkish and I’ve grown to love Mediterranean cuisine along side her. This place was always great but packed at the night markets and eat the street, and I am so happy they were able to set up shop permanently so we can make reservations and get our fix more often! 5 stars.

Absolutely incredible! The food was very authentic, the servers attentive and nice. I can not recommend this place enough. As for food recommendations: Iskender Döner, Baklava, Organic Tandoor Chicken Wings and Künefe! Worth every penny.

I had the Pirzola (lamb chops) & it was definitely the best I’ve had in Honolulu. The portions are closer to that of tapas - but - think quality & not quantity! It’s authentic people cooking authentic food & we can’t wait to go back!

My wife and I love trying new places to eat, and this one has been on our radar for a few months ever since we noticed the sign pop up across the street from Whole Foods. We rarely get to eat foods from that region because Hawaii has a higher demand for Asian cuisine. We went for one of their soft opening days, and it happened to be the busiest day for them since their opening. I dont like to judge a place by their soft opening, but in this case, I feel confident that I understand their concept. We sat at the bar with the bar manager as our waiter and bartender. He was very busy, but took the time to introduce the food and wine to us. The wine menu was filled with Greek and Turkish wine that was a wonderful surprise. The menu was pretty straight forward, but is to be expected when first opening. We tried the appetizer platter, the turkish style "ravioli", and a kebab. The appetizers took quite a while to come out, but I'm not surprised because they were quite busy and everyone was learning how to work with each other in a new system. The food was DELICIOUS and the entrees came out in good time after our first round. We tried several glasses of wine each and the food paired quite well with the assortment of Mediterranean varietals. All in all I give this new restaurant 5 stars and two thumbs up for being a new restaurant in a quite fancy neighborhood. The prices were a bit high, but factoring in for convenience and ambiance, well worth it.
Fantastic dining experience! Congratulations on this project, amazing food, lovely setting, true Turkish food, its like being transported to Istanbul! what a delight!

Ambiance, food and service, everything about this place is on point.  The bartender was great.  If your ever in the area then treat yourself.  You won't regret it.  For the price range, this is easily one of the best restaurants on Oahu.  And they were even accommadating for a Keto diet.  Just an FYI, I don't give every place a five star.  This place was great!
